Detailed Description

cvmx-log supplies a fast log buffer implementation.

Each core writes log data to a differnet buffer to avoid synchronization overhead. Function call logging can be turned on with the GCC option "-pg".

Define Documentation

#define CVMX_LOG_BUFFER_SIZE   (1<<15)
#define CVMX_LOG_NUM_BUFFERS   4

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvmx_log_type_t

The possible types of log data that can be stored in the buffer.

Enumerator:
CVMX_LOG_TYPE_PC 

Log of the program counter location.

used for code profiling / tracing

CVMX_LOG_TYPE_PRINTF 

Constant printf format string with two 64bit arguments.

CVMX_LOG_TYPE_DATA 

Arbitrary array of dwords.

Max size is 31 dwords

CVMX_LOG_TYPE_STRUCTURE 

Log a structured data element.

Max size is 30 dwords

CVMX_LOG_TYPE_PERF 

Mips performance counters control registers followed by the data.

static void __cvmx_log_full_process ( void   )  [static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Called when the log is full of data. This function must make room for more log data before returning.

Function to write and increment the position. It rotates to the next log buffer as necessary.

void cvmx_log_data ( uint64_t  size_in_dwords,
const uint64_t *  data 
)

Log an arbitrary block of 64bit words.

At most 255 64bit words can be logged. The words are copied into the log.

Parameters:
size_in_dwords Number of 64bit dwords to copy into the log.
data Array of 64bit dwords to copy
void cvmx_log_display ( void   ) 

Display the current log in a human readable format.

void cvmx_log_pc ( uint64_t  pc  ) 

Log a program counter address to the log.

This is caused by the assembly code function mcount when writing the PC value is more complicated that the simple case support by it.

Parameters:
pc Program counter address to log

void cvmx_log_printf0 ( const char *  format  ) 

Log a constant printf style format string with 0 to 4 arguments.

Log a constant printf style format string without arguments.

The string must persist until the log is read, but the parameters are copied into the log.

Parameters:
format Constant printf style format string.

void cvmx_log_structure ( const char *  type,
void *  data,
int  size_in_bytes 
)

Log a structured data object.

Post processing will use the debugging information in the ELF file to determine how to display the structure. Max of 2032 bytes.

Example: cvmx_log_structure("cvmx_wqe_t", work, sizeof(*work));

Parameters:
type C typedef expressed as a string. This will be used to lookup the structure in the debugging infirmation.
data Data to be written to the log.
size_in_bytes Size if the data in bytes. Normally you'll use the sizeof() operator here.

uint64_t* cvmx_log_buffer_end_ptr = NULL

uint64_t* cvmx_log_buffer_read_ptr = NULL [static]
uint64_t* cvmx_log_buffer_write_ptr = NULL

Current locations in the log.

uint64_t cvmx_log_buffers[CVMX_LOG_NUM_BUFFERS][CVMX_LOG_BUFFER_SIZE] [static]

Circular log buffer.

Each processor gets a private one to write to. Log entries are added at the current write location, then the write location is incremented. The buffer may wrap in the middle of a log entry.

uint64_t cvmx_log_mcd0_on_full = 0
